message_1: What is the standard enthalpy change for the combustion of methane (CH4) gas at 298 K and 1 atm?
message_2: The standard enthalpy change for the combustion of methane (CH4) gas at 298 K and 1 atm is -890.3 kJ/mol. This value represents the amount of heat released when one mole of methane is completely combusted in excess oxygen under standard conditions.
